Wadsworth.Action: Arrives at an imposing, menacing house alone, calmly opens the gates with appropriate butler demeanor.
Sits back in car after opening gates and then slowly drives up the private drive, showing calmness and control in a tense setting.
Throws raw meat to chained aggressive dogs to calmly distract them and avoid conflict.
Methodically locks car, cleans shoe after stepping in dog feces, and carefully inspects surroundings, showing professionalism over friendliness.
Watches Yvette, the French Maid, as she adjusts her dress and gives instructions in brief and businesslike manner.
Locks the car methodically and handles aggressive dogs by distracting them with meat to ensure safe entry.
Steps into dog feces but remains composed and continues entering the house without hesitation.
Opens the front door methodically, observes surroundings, and notes the meticulous dinner setting, showing attention to detail.
Confidently checks with Yvette that everything is ready and confirms instructions have been followed.
Politely greets the cook and inquires if everything is all right.
Speaks kindly and reassuringly to the man outside the door, confirming he is expected and offering to take his coat.
Maintains professional and courteous demeanor but is somewhat formal and reserved, no overt friendly or warm behavior otherwise shown.
Confidently oversees the household, checks the time, and calmly opens the door for an unexpected guest.
Quickly reassures the hesitant Colonel by confirming his identity and inviting him in.
Politely offers to take the Colonel's coat and tries to confirm his identity, showing attention to detail and social grace.
Politely asks Yvette to attend to Colonel Mustard's needs within reason.
Sharply holds up his hand, causing Colonel Mustard to flinch.
Welcomes Mrs. White warmly, indicating she is expected.
Uses a pseudonym on employer's behalf, somewhat secretive.
Firmly commands attention by holding up his hand sharply, causing Colonel Mustard to flinch.
Calmly uses a pseudonym and deflects Colonel Mustard's suspicion with a polite but firm explanation.
Takes initiative by hanging up Colonel Mustard's coat smoothly and confidently.
Leads Colonel Mustard across the hall despite his reluctance, showing leadership and control of the situation.
Notices the exchanged looks between Yvette and Colonel Mustard and immediately delegates Yvette to attend to the Colonel with clear instructions, demonstrating situational awareness and management.
Exits the room silently and closes the door softly, maintaining an atmosphere of control and discretion.
Disappears from sight in a way that even obscures the door location from Colonel Mustard, suggesting skillful and subtle movement.
Opens the door to Mrs. White politely and confidently, indicating that her arrival was expected and under his control.
Politely opens the door and invites Mrs. White in, saying 'Do come in, Madam, you are expected.'
Helps Mrs. White off with her coat and hangs it up for her.
Introduces Mrs. White to Yvette the maid, noting the tension between them and acknowledging it calmly.
Asks Colonel Mustard if he is all right after the door flattens him against the wall.
Introduces guests politely and ensures the dinner will be ready after all arrive.
Introduces guests properly and directs the servant to prepare dinner at the appropriate time.
Allows Mrs. Peacock to watch Yvette with slight incredulity but does not intervene or explain, potentially missing a chance to manage perceptions better.
Calmly opens the door for guests, correctly identifies Mr. Green and instructs him to 'Sit!' demonstrating control and attention to detail.

Opens door to drenched guests immediately, displays polite surprise
Offers drinks to guests courteously using a silver salver

Comments on use of pseudonyms to maintain secrecy, indicating strategic awareness and control of the environment.

Responds to Mrs. Peacock's admiring glance with a calm, brief acknowledgment ('I know, Madam').

Responds to Mr. Boddy's sneering and unpleasant demeanor with measured politeness but with a biting remark, indicating limited tolerance.

Responds to Mr. Boddy's sneer with a controlled, sharp-witted reply, maintaining control of the situation.
